document.title: Florida Department of Education 2024-25 CTE Curriculum Frameworks

0517A5066C96471282CAEC514C49C090.description: Troubleshoot and debug errors in code.

FD6154A6FA694F59B75ED853C618AA45.description: Convert a simple program from pseudo-code into a common high-level programming environment (e.g. Alice, Greenfoot).

F13817EA10DA40BABC19B9F44DAB8134.description: Create a simple program that uses animated objects.

C809A8BAB3A4466CA6A78C1A0C89B300.description: Create animated objects using a high-level programming environment (e.g., Alice, Greenfoot) to control their behavior.

9D62A306D94E4C8CA371D8A9104993F6.description: Describe fundamental Boolean concepts, including Boolean algebra, operators, logic.

B5DF7C4D71514C7B8BEE1C5DBFC0C17A.description: Explain the types and uses of variables in programming.

560FDF74A8614F6B9C1CDC02CBBB1BC5.description: Write a simple program in pseudo-code that uses structured programming to solve a problem.

D7974D9EDC6C4B7F88AB52FCB9D5B685.description: Describe selection programming structures (e.g., if/then, else) and explain the logic used for if statements.

9C3F977776CD45859BBC0B2E9C1B9FC2.description: Describe iterative programming structures (e.g., while, do/while) and how they are used in programming.

F53CFC83AD1C4524BCD61D95C086ECB6.description: Define the three main programming control structures used in structured programming: sequential, selection (decision), and iteration (loops).

DB2E62324A164488ADFB7F301F50530E.description: Define “structured programming” and discuss the advantages of this approach.

289CE2AE77844BE8ADEE6F1CB726CEDD.description: Solve a problem using logic by planning a strategy, designing and testing a hypothesis, and/or creating a set of step-by-step instructions to perform a task.

400CC8A2BAD742FBBC98E7A450C61A93.description: Explain the three types of programming errors (i.e., logic, syntax, runtime), and describe the forms of testing that can be used to locate and debug errors.

2EDCEFFF07B042DE8E52ED7369E4ED56.description: Define the term “algorithm,” and explain how it relates to problem-solving.

1C971F965F694E1EA48273D9A0373E24.description: Explain strategies used in problem-solving, and relate them to computer programming.

CD478E29D98D4AA3AECEC91212C7A26A.description: Write a program design document using pseudo-code that shows program flow.

229995BAB46E4EFEB4AFA6201248B618.description: Describe the structure of a simple program, and explain why sequencing is important.

735B5CCBA7E74A78A7559A43B43BAD1C.description: Compare and contrast languages that are usually compiled (e.g., C++, Java) and interpreted (e.g., JavaScript, Python).

C5A813DFF7064B759015681171EC1A4D.description: Distinguish among the three types of programming languages (machine, assembly, high-level), and give examples.

78320F986B3F41DA86E7C36FCA139ED7.description: Explain the binary representation of data and programs in computers.

85D29F89222D4C1A818139278580E568.description: Define “programming” and discuss its role in computing.

2131B2E181F944C5919FA393EFD8EEDD.description: Demonstrate proficiency in basic programming.  The student will be able to:

463B5739F5F24500B1E18DE6AF2A76AA.description: Use programming code to control the behavior of an animated object (i.e., sprite) in a game program.

0AE35D9C3A4F4E1F868C10FEF93308F1.description: Create an animated object (i.e., sprite) to be used in a game program.

0C2FF00D5CFC48AE912BA060CAFFE0E3.description: Modify the game program as needed to solve a problem.

10393A81B02D40DF9B462DD3CA7DE64E.description: Test and evaluate the game program you created.

D0E2E26EAC9646CD89CDC84985EC7681.description: Write appropriate code to create a simple game using structured programming.

96030C359D2D4F739655D94CCE23535E.description: Describe the use of properties and methods with objects in game programming.

E535F9B46C954E8B85511A91E02ACBC2.description: Describe the use of objects, classes and instances in game programming.

28587C96AE9547A4BCAD263934ECAA79.description: Describe the use of parameters and arguments in game programming.

BF3F2A862BDC4D89982A2A94E863078F.description: Describe the use of events, event handlers and functions in game programming.

5328F0003C3341AFBFCE107BC9691FB0.description: Describe basic Boolean concepts, including logical operators, order of precedence, expressions.

C5AEC380D3D0455D804E175B3E7FA34E.description: Explain the types and uses of variables in game programming.

AA6FC7E74A3540008F8D339820E21C3E.description: Define logic errors and identify them in a game program or model.

53735C1B4894434F94E95F858B7F1D45.description: Use pseudo-code to model a game program’s flow.

3BC7F1B973D34175A7081D6D46C495BD.description: Create an algorithm to solve a problem or complete a task.

CAB25904F12441889E1E6F03C7699500.description: Define the term algorithm (i.e., a set of repeatable steps) and how it applies to problem solving.

6ABA6A96334E41BD96ADCBC6D99661E5.description: Compare sequential, iteration (loop) and selection programming structures.

54E6042F94C448CB9437C13D7094638A.description: Identify common programming languages and applications used to create computer games.

368C8BE375614DF18CB7206EF2B6E1F2.description: Identify the programmer’s role in creating games.

21BD57D4C10F4EF68E2A3297342C1291.description: Create storyboards to model a game’s program flow and functionality.

65DA90E6D4CA42318F95A65C5AF5E40F.description: Identify the tools and skills needed for creating games.

1808D7958BD741F481431DA7FF0F4757.description: Apply the design process to solving a problem.

A7E98CC49A3648B0A9B135320964AFAD.description: Identify the steps of the design process for creating a game.

A82484189D0949BFBE67DBFDF6078D2F.description: Identify various types of games (e.g., chance, skill, knowledge, role-playing, and storytelling).

5A1F5EB460DE4317AA95501BD98B50B3.description: Describe the role of games in modern society (e.g., education, task training, social networking, therapy, recreation).

534C83AE2284451BAAE10BE021900696.description: Demonstrate proficiency in game development.  The student will be able to:

07BE2AFED35347AEAF6F27FCFE2F2947.description: Describe website security methods, including secure server vs. unsecured served, SSL, SSH, encryption.

86977B749F984EE1A5B5EBFA61A17A2D.description: Explain the purpose of File Transfer Protocol (FTP) in accessing information on the Internet.

4F3D4E81400B4C7A9DD43F5BF6855B41.description: Describe network issues relating to websites, including bandwidth, compression, streaming, web hosting.

B91D820054EE411CB047C621B96DDB03.description: Validate webpage code using W3C validation tools before publishing a site to the Internet.

2444B6E62D4442F7AF417E888FD56501.description: Test webpages for display, functionality, and accessibility before publishing a site to the Internet.

9A2340E385BC4FCD8D974100E7DB513C.description: Review webpage content, verify copyright restrictions, and create meta-data before publishing a site to the internet.

BD462101FB944FCC8755E4AE82FACEDD.description: Create and use a social media page (e.g., Facebook, Wimba, Edmodo) and/or a blog to share content and collaborate on projects.

09041D3AF8574D639780037FDB901FF7.description: Create and use a wiki or similar tool for collaborating among project team members.

A498B56A168540659002478D1EC5F793.description: Use Dynamic HTML (DHTML) to enhance webpage interactivity.

235E91D77391455084001BF30C640C43.description: Create and/or edit video files, and integrate them into a webpage

F5C24D25CBD945C097178D5F766CAC42.description: Create and/or edit animation files, and integrate them into a webpage.

CA6E2A4D5D0041FD8764B0D5DBB45D47.description: Apply CSS styles to an HTML page.

A43DD7852C5C45A68B9748F91A26ECF7.description: Use HTML to insert common image file formats into webpages, and use an image as a hyperlink.

9A662237F94449E597C3801DE6021E96.description: Use HTML to create hyperlinks to external sites.

2DD1876AB6104C639BD13BE3D8B5A64C.description: Create webpages using basic HTML tags (e.g., headings, lists, character styles, text alignment, tables, comments).

210F96FB90FA47D49706927B568C7671.description: Identify HTML elements required to create webpage structure.

7E6B1F78DEB74DCFAC70AEFECA9A058C.description: Define “HTML (Hypertext Markup Language)” and related terms, including tag element, vs.  container vs. empty tag, block-level vs. inline element, attribute value, semantic tag.

FE01786CE1C94710B159560227C84B51.description: Create a website using a template.

82DFFDD622094A6C8CC92A4AC804380C.description: Modify an existing webpage template to create an effective look and feel for a website.

FA78C057BC9A445C92381B33866B33E0.description: Compare website creation using an online site builder, an offline site builder and a content management system (CMS).

C54D2C1F749B4F28AB2C69B3CB8FA0C1.description: Compare webpage creation using an HTML text editor to using a graphical user interface (GUI) editor.

E706ADA1B0FB4A92B7F6DD47860A5C98.description: Build the site navigation scheme for a website.

37AE78E5692341D4B5836F8FA16D131E.description: Apply the website planning process to plan the design for basic website.

052B04D8B7DB40E197426EE7C0EDF452.description: Explain the primary steps of the website planning process.

3D561BF3D26941A48FC790829285CA52.description: Define multimedia, and identify its role in webpage interactivity.

8C8D407933FD4B3BBE54D75E377ED55D.description: Critique the aesthetic design, usability and accessibility of sample websites.

A9ED6B8F9046459D8C12ADE9CABA6B54.description: Compare functional and usable design principles, and explain how usability can affect a website’s success.

476268B4D4514CDD8E30803F6A14DB4D.description: Demonstrate knowledge of color wheel concepts and effective use of color on a website.

DCDEF852832044EC8FEA7971982D6FE5.description: Define aesthetic design, and explain how aesthetics can affect a visitors’ perception of a website’s information.

2D1E1A5F48274796B0BAF1B215B0D0FB.description: Relate basic components of a webpage (e.g. color, space, written content, typography, images, links, multimedia) to aesthetic, functional and/or usable design principals.

541485D9E04944AEB591C3C2F29ABBE2.description: Identify website domains, and relate a site’s domain to its purpose.

5D63E3CCA21C4C99AFCDD099FC38EA40.description: Demonstrate proficiency in webpage development.  The student will be able to:

D214EF23083B43A69AC2162B1DCA9299.description: Describe the OSI reference model and its layers, including tracing the flow of data between two network nodes through the OSI layers.

7C3341D705DC45E5873DF7774815185D.description: Describe the purpose and function of IP addressing and distinguish between public and private IP addresses.

1860F146235042BBBC4B515D077E9B32.description: Describe the purpose of protocols, and identify the protocols commonly used in networks, including TCP/IP, DHCP, DNS, HTTP, FTP, IMAP, POP, SMTP.

1892E99B0B6B420E9AF33D98D36EB053.description: Describe the functions of various network hardware devices, including NIC, hub, switch, router, bridge, gateway, access point.

0527BC94508F4FF8A5FE43125D32D5B3.description: Compare various methods and media for network connections, including broadband, wireless, Bluetooth, cellular, satellite.

08658E53525B4C268B0EE2A49AEE4FF8.description: Compare various network models and their advantages, including client/server, mainframe/terminal, peer-to-peer.

005926F5911F44CB8C3CCAC83BF9CFA7.description: Compare common network topologies, including bus, star, ring, mesh.

CC4466D3087B4E2E85217DDAE5ADBB6C.description: Compare types of networks, including LAN, WAN, MAN, VPN, intranet, extranet, the Internet.

678CA8A111624DF089073248618B1B6D.description: Define “network” and give examples of networks used at home, school, and work.

FFB5332177304642A7E508FB07B677B8.description: Demonstrate an understanding of computer networks.  The student will be able to:

9E4977AD47ED418DBC5F23829369082B.description: Create and use a social media page (e.g., Wikis, Wimba, Moodle, Edmodo, Facebook, Schoology, Gaggle) to share and publish project components (e.g., content, images, graphics, videos) for gauging visitor reaction and obtaining feedback.

1E304309EAB94B80B67751363E461E54.description: Create and use a collaborative environment for communicating and sharing among project team members.

002CD3F2F2F449CBB790EBD21D8EC826.description: Use Web 2.0 or Internet-based collaborative technology (e.g., Wikis, Wimba, Moodle, Edmodo, Facebook, Schoology, Gaggle) to facilitate a web development or research project. The student will be able to:
